titleStmt.title: A most pleasant comedie of Mucedorus the kings sonne of Valentia and Amadine the Kings daughter of Arragon with the merie conceites of Mouse. Newly set foorth, as it hath bin sundrie times plaide in the honorable cittie of London. Very delectable and full of mirth.
Mucedorus.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for William Iones, dwelling at Holborne conduit, at the signe of the Gunne,

notesStmt.note: Misattributed to Robert Greene and to William Shakespeare.
Running title reads: The comedie of Mucedorus.
Both known copies have a cancel slip on B1r.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
